properties.name: Ljubljana, Slovenia
properties.title: (W.E.Talk) Danilo Türk: I believe that the civilizations must and will cooperate
properties.description: "I believe that the theory of 'clash of civilizations', which was proposed for discussion some 30 years ago, has serious flaws. Because there is no inevitability." During the forum, Danilo Türk, President of the World Leadership Alliance - Club de Madrid, former President of Slovenia, former President of the UN Security Council and Assistant Secretary-General, pointed out in an exclusive interview with the "W. E. Talk" by China News Service that "clash of civilization" was a real historic phenomenon and problem, but not destiny indeed.

properties.name: Jakarta, Indonesia
properties.title: Xi congratulates Prabowo Subianto on assuming presidency of Indonesia::Flagship BRI project in Indonesia marks anniversary
properties.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Sunday sent a congratulatory message to Prabowo Subianto on assuming the presidency of Indonesia.::The Jakarta-Bandung High-Speed Railway, a flagship project of the China-proposed Belt and Road Initiative, marked the first anniversary of its official operation on Thursday, showcasing impressive achievements in both transportation and economic development.

properties.name: Beijing, China
properties.title: China Weekly (Oct. 12-18)::Washington urged to stop tarnishing Beijing::Autopsy finds monkeys at Hong Kong zoo died of bacterial infection::China-LAC media forum calls for joint efforts::Xi hails establishment of major recycling company::Nation to build unified market::Financial Street Forum annual conference opens in Beijing::We tell our story in language of architecture: Young architect from China's Mongolian ethnic group::Hot topics set for discussion in Beijing::China enhances cooperation with U.S. to curb migrant smuggling::China sees influx of visa-free foreigners::Beijing Intellectual Property Court sees popularity home, abroad::China faces uphill battle against escalating dengue infections::China's GDP expands 4.8% in first three quarters::China's central bank may further cut reserve ratio: central bank chief::Supermoon observed across China::Major differences exist in China-EU EV tariff negotiations: MOC::China, Pacific island nations eye prosperity::Measures unveiled to stabilize property market::UK foreign secretary's China visit to 'enhance strategic mutual trust'::China delivers on parcel delivery services in rural areas::Former COFCO official pleads guilty to charges::Over 150 countries commit to carbon neutrality targets, report says::Washington welcomes two new giant pandas::Sichuan golden snub-nosed monkeys play at Yuhe National Natural Reserve in Gansu::China's game industry seeing speedy growth momentum::Ministry aims to increase affordable housing supply::Xi wishes local people a more prosperous life::British Foreign Secretary Lammy to visit China: FM::55 officials punished for deadly January fire::Communication, remote-sensing satellites in orbit::Central banks of China, Pakistan renew currency swap agreement::Xi, Mongolian leader hail ties over 75 years::60 years on, China maintains peaceful nuclear pursuit::China aims to drive trilateral cooperation with Russia, Mongolia::How caretakers in Ocean Park Hong Kong feed panda cubs?::'Most beautiful highway for self-driving in Xinjiang' opens to trial traffic::Exercise of Chinese aircraft carrier is part of annual schedule: defense spokesperson::China launches new satellite group::China's countryside to have brighter prospect: Xi
properties.description: People's Bank of China may further cut commercial bank's reserve requirement ratio by 0.25 to 0.5 percentage points in the fourth quarter. And China will expand its "white list" program to allow unfinished housing projects and developers to access credit, with the loan quota set to reach about $561.8 billion by the end of the year....::China expressed opposition on Friday to the sanctions imposed by the United States on its enterprises for alleged support of Russia in the Ukraine crisis, urging Washington to immediately stop tarnishing and oppressing Beijing.::Citing an autopsy report, an official said on Friday that abrupt death of nine monkeys in two days at a Hong Kong zoo was caused by melioidosis, a bacterial infection.::Representatives from over 13 countries and regions gathered in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil on Wednesday to participate in the 2024 China-LAC Media Cooperation Forum.::President Xi Jinping has stressed the importance of creating a national resources recycling and utilization platform as China established on Friday a State-owned company specializing in resources recycling across sectors including steel, nonferrous metals, consumer goods, and wind and solar power equipment.::China will push ahead with the building of a unified national market as part of the country's efforts to foster a more equitable and well-ordered development environment for market players, the State Council — the nation's Cabinet — said on Friday.::The Financial Street Forum 2024 is ongoing from October 18 to 20 in Beijing under the theme "Trust and Confidence – Work Together To Promote Financial Openness, Cooperate For Shared Economic Stability and Growth". In this feast of ideas, industry heavyweights will share their insights on China's economic recovery and foreign investment confidence in the country.::::A prestigious financial event is to commence on Friday in Beijing, where senior government officials, along with experts, scholars and representatives from global financial institutions, will deliver keynote speeches.::The National Immigration Administration said it is strengthening cooperation with immigration departments in the United States and other countries to combat migrant smuggling.::China has seen a surge of entry from foreigners during the third quarter this year, statistics from the National Immigration Administration showed.::"We've obtained thank you notes from many foreign litigants, international organizations and leading enterprises in multiple industries," Lu Guang, spokesman of the court, said at a news conference.::China faces increasing challenges to control the spread of dengue fever, together with the increasing global incidences of the disease over the past two decades, according to recent research.::China's gross domestic product (GDP) reached around 94.97 trillion yuan (about $13.33 trillion) in the first three quarters of 2024, up 4.8 percent year-on-year, according to data released on Friday by the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS).::China’s central bank would consider further cutting commercial bank’s reserve requirement ratio (RRR) by   by the year-end depending on liquidity conditions, said the bank’s governor Pan Gongsheng on Friday at the Financial Street Forum 2024.::A supermoon is seen in Shenzhen, Guangdong Province, Oct. 17, 2024.::Major differences still exist in China-EU electric vehicle tariff negotiations, as the EU failed to respond to the core concerns of both Chinese and European industries, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce said on Thursday.::China's relations with Pacific island countries are open and aboveboard without any geopolitical intentions, and are not for its own selfish interests or directed against any third party, a senior Communist Party of China official said on Thursday.::China will renovate an additional 1 million units of urban village and dilapidated housing through a monetary compensation approach, said Ni Hong, minister of housing and urban-rural development, on Thursday.::UK Foreign Secretary David Lammy's visit to China on Friday and Saturday will mark a significant opportunity for a new beginning in Sino-British relations.As China transitions from an economy focused on quantity to one that emphasizes quality, British expertise could play a critical role in this shift.　　The UK's world-class educational institutions, in particular, are well-placed to support China's aspirations to become a more innovation-driven economy.::China has made remarkable strides in expanding its parcel delivery services to rural areas, addressing the critical "last-kilometer" challenge, according to the State Post Bureau of China.::Zhou Zheng, former deputy general manager of China's leading agricultural and food trader COFCO Corp, pleaded guilty to taking bribes, embezzlement and abuse of power while standing trial in Yuncheng, Shanxi province, on Thursday.::As of May, 151 countries have committed to carbon neutrality targets, with 120 of them legally enshrining these goals through laws or policy documents, according to the latest report.::A pair of giant pandas, Bao Li and Qing Bao, which arrived at the Washington Zoo Tuesday, are both doing well, said Brandie Smith, director of the Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, D.C. "They are exploring their habitat."::Sichuan golden snub-nosed monkeys are seen playing at Yuhe National Natural Reserve in Wudu District, Longnan City, northwest China's Gansu Province, Oct. 16, 2024.::China's gaming industry reached a record high in revenue, hitting 91.77 billion yuan ($12.89 billion) in the third quarter of 2024, marking an 8.95 percent increase year-on-year, according to an industry report released on Wednesday.::On Thursday, Minister of Housing and Urban-Rural Development Ni Hong announced plans to increase the affordable housing supply for including young people and newcomers, as the nation works to relax rules on home buying.::President Xi Jinping on Tuesday afternoon inspected Aojiao village of Dongshan county in Zhangzhou city, Fujian province, and wished the local people a more prosperous life.::Britain's Foreign Secretary David Lammy will visit China from Friday to Saturday at the invitation of Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, said Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson Mao Ning on Thursday.::Fifty-five officials were punished after they were found responsible for a fire that killed 39 people and injured nine in January at a building complex in Xinyu, Jiangxi province, according to a notice released by the provincial discipline inspection commission and supervisory commission on Wednesday.::China launched a group of 18 communications satellites from the Taiyuan Satellite Launch Center in Shanxi province on Tuesday evening, deploying the second batch of equipment in the Spacesail Constellation network into orbit.::China's central bank, the People's Bank of China, said in a statement released on Wednesday that it has renewed bilateral currency swap agreement with the State Bank of Pakistan.::President Xi Jinping and Mongolian President Ukhnaa Khurelsukh exchanged messages to celebrate the 75th anniversary of bilateral diplomatic ties on Wednesday, pledging joint efforts to take forward this relationship for the benefit of both peoples.::On Oct. 16, 1964, China successfully detonated its first self-made atomic bomb in Lop Nor, Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, shattering the nuclear monopoly of Western countries and becoming the fifth nation with nuclear arms in the world.::China is willing to work with Russia and Mongolia to further enhance mutual trust and drive trilateral cooperation to go deeper and to better benefit the people of the three countries, Premier Li Qiang said.::Ocean Park Hong Kong on Monday said its baby twin pandas are now two months old and are growing up stably.::Ahe highway in northwest China's Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region has opened to trial traffic.::The Chinese People's Liberation Army Navy recently organized the Liaoning aircraft carrier group to conduct routine exercises in waters in the South China Sea.::China sent a new satellite group into space on Tuesday from the Taiyuan Satellite Launch Center in north China's Shanxi Province.::China's countryside will surely have a brighter prospect and farmers will have a more prosperous life on the new journey in the new era, said Xi Jinping, general secretary of the Communist Party of China Central Committee.

properties.name: Guangzhou, China
properties.title: Unlocking Chinese Cities: The global hub for trendsetting wigs

properties.name: Johannesburg, South Africa
properties.title: BRICS urged to enhance its solidarity
properties.description: Beijing has highlighted the need for BRICS to build on openness and solidarity among the Global South countries, as the Foreign Ministry announced that President Xi Jinping will attend the 16th BRICS Summit in Kazan, Russia, from Tuesday to Thursday.

properties.name: Arlington, United States
properties.title: Rangers maintain family tradition of service
properties.description: In the heart of the Baihe National Nature Reserve, nestled in Jiuzhaigou county, the Aba Tibetan and Qiang autonomous prefecture in Sichuan province, approximately 1,700 wild Sichuan golden snub-nosed monkeys find joy in their natural habitat. Watching over them day and night are dedicated rangers.

properties.name: London, United Kingdom
properties.title: Q3 growth ups hopes of meeting full-year target::Mathematicians help to cure cancer in a creative manner::Peking Opera with a difference wows London audience
properties.description: China's stronger-than-expected 4.6-percent economic expansion in the third quarter has bolstered the confidence in the world's second-largest economy of achieving its full-year growth target, with growth momentum to further accelerate in the rest of the year, officials and analysts said.::A recent academic essay on maths is expected to help in treatment of intestine cancer by creating a model for new drugs to be developed.::A production fusing traditional Chinese opera with Western classical music took place in London on Thursday, when a performance inspired by the life of Cai Lun, the man credited with the invention of paper, took place at the Jerwood Hall.
properties.source: China News Service (CNS)::China News Service (CNS)::China News Service (CNS)

properties.name: Tokyo, Japan
properties.title: Survey to shed light on declining birthrates
properties.description: China will carry out a nationwide sample survey covering 30,000 people to comprehensively examine causes of people's reluctance and fear of having children and formulate fertility supportive policies, according to China Population and Development Research Center.

properties.name: Hefei, China
properties.title: Anhui's key role in national strategies highlighted
properties.description: President Xi Jinping has urged Anhui Province to leverage its role in multiple national development strategies to build itself into a significant hub for promoting scientific and technological innovation, fostering emerging industries, driving reform and opening-up, and pioneering green transformation.

properties.name: New York City, United States
properties.title: Strong sales for high quality livestreaming
properties.description: Top-tier livestreaming sales host Li Jiaqi notched sales champion for the presale session of China's "Double Eleven" online shopping frenzy, which falls on Nov. 11.

properties.name: Seoul, South Korea
properties.title: Visa-free entries spur cross-border travel::Minister suggests accelerating regulatory system for autonomous driving sector
properties.description: The number of foreigners entering China visa-free saw a surge in the third quarter as a result of the country's continuous efforts to invigorate cross-border travel, the National Immigration Administration said.::Jin Zhuanglong, minister of industry and information technology, said that the country will step up making standards and regulations and building a comprehensive regulatory system for high-level autonomous driving.

properties.name: Taiyuan, China
properties.title: Shanxi opens largest tourism highway network
properties.description: A tourist road network spanning 13,000 kilometers, largest of its kind in China, was opened in Shanxi province, officials announced on Friday.

properties.name: Sydney, Australia
properties.title: Job market remains stable despite fluctuation::Smart tech set to help beef up coal output
properties.description: China's overall job landscape remained stable despite a seasonal fluctuation in the employment rate during the third quarter, thanks to the nation's stronger economic growth and employers' unchanged needs for new recruits.::As energy demand in China peaks during the winter, Shanxi province, one of the major power hubs in the country, is strengthening efforts to ensure stable coal supply through intelligent transformation.

properties.name: Weifang, China
properties.title: Weifang Port certified as China's first zero-carbon emission port
properties.description: Weifang Port, which is part of Shandong Port Group subsidiary Bohaiwan Port, said it had become China's first zero-carbon emission port, marking a milestone in the country's push toward sustainability and green development.

properties.name: Zhangzhou, China
properties.title: Cradle of Civilization: Zhangzhou Ancient City
properties.description: Situated on the banks of the Jiulong River, the Zhangzhou Ancient City had been a political and economic center for the region since Tang Dynasty (618-907).

properties.name: Lhasa, China
properties.title: How foreign teachers and students describe Xizang in one word
properties.description: "What does Xizang look like in your eyes?" Foreign teachers and students from 12 countries, including the UK, the US, and Mongolia, described it as beautiful, mysterious, colorful, and all-embracing...

properties.name: Lanzhou, China
properties.title: Students thrive with rope-jumping at Gansu school
properties.description: Zhongzhai Primary School in Wenxian County, Gansu province, has set a model in promoting rope-jumping among students since 2022 in response to the country's calling for more emphasis on comprehensive student development.

properties.name: Yinchuan, China
properties.title: Ningxia launches new pet flight service
properties.description: A chartered flight for pets landed in Zhongwei, Ningxia Hui autonomous region, on Oct. 16, inaugurating a new service model for the local airport.

properties.name: Shanghai, China
properties.title: Chinese shares soar on Friday::Shanghai gears up for 7th China International Import Expo::Shanghai Jiao Tong University wins international students' innovation competition::Tesla yet to receive regulatory green light for FSD in China::Shanghai leg of the FISE World Series kicks off::Forum builds on transport growth in Shanghai::Chinese company achieves photoresist breakthrough
properties.description: Chinese stocks closed higher on Friday, with the benchmark Shanghai Composite Index up 2.91 percent at 3,261.56 points.The ChiNext Index, China's NASDAQ-style board of growth enterprises, rose 7.95 percent to close at 2195.10 points.::Shanghai is gearing up for the upcoming 7th China International Import Expo, CCTV reported on Friday.::Six teams of aspiring student innovators from among the world's top universities have made it to the final of the 2024 China International College Students' Innovation Competition, held in Shanghai on Tuesday.::Multiple sources told China Daily that Tesla Inc has yet to receive regulatory approval from Chinese authorities to launch its full self-driving or FSD functions in the country and is seeking permission to gather some data on its own to train its autonomous driving system.::The Shanghai leg of the FISE World Series kicks off on Wednesday in Xuhui district's West Bund.The Shanghai leg of the FISE World Series, a global extreme sports tour from France and in its 27th year, kicked off on Wednesday in Xuhui district's West Bund.::With a theme of 'Digital, Smart and Green: Co-creating a New Ecosystem of Global Shipping and Aviation', the 2024 North Bund Forum will take place in Shanghai next week, running from Oct 22-24, officials said on Tuesday.::A Chinese company has achieved a game-changing breakthrough in photoresist, a key material for semiconductor lithography machines, successfully passing mass production tests, according to officials from Optics Valley of China, a high-tech development zone in Wuhan, Hubei province.
properties.source: China News Service (CNS)::China News Service (CNS)::China News Service (CNS)::China News Service (CNS)::China News Service (CNS)::China News Service (CNS)::China News Service (CNS)

properties.name: Kazan, Russia
properties.title: Xi to attend 16th BRICS Summit in Kazan, Russia
properties.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will attend the 16th BRICS Summit in Kazan, Russia, from Oct. 22 to 24 at the invitation of President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin, foreign ministry spokesperson Hua Chunying announced here on Friday.

properties.name: Mexico City, Mexico
properties.title: Comicomment: Wherever its hands reach, chaos follows
properties.description: In reality, the U.S. exports instability, undermining international order and threatening global peace, making it the largest source of unrest and a major disruptor of peace and security worldwide.

properties.name: Washington, D.c., United States
properties.title: New York Comic Con kicks off at Javits Center in Manhattan::Pandas Bao Li and Qing Bao in good shape at Smithsonian's National Zoo
properties.description: The New York Comic Con, one of the most eagerly-awaited events for pop culture fans, kicks off at the Javits Center in Manhattan on Oct. 17, 2024.::Photo released on Dec. 16, 2024 shows panda Qing Bao eats bamboo at the Smithsonian's National Zoo in Washington, DC.

properties.name: Zhangjiajie, China
properties.title: After-rain scenery of Zhangjiajie National Forest Park in Central China's Hunan
properties.description: Photo taken on Oct. 17, 2024 shows the picturesque view of Zhangjiajie National Forest Park after rain in Central China’s Hunan.

properties.name: Bern, Switzerland
properties.title: Institutions release 2024 Global Carbon Neutrality Annual Progress Report
properties.description: Tsinghua University released the 2024 Global Carbon Neutrality Annual Progress Report in Beijing on Thursday.

properties.name: Bangkok, Thailand
properties.title: Thai PM eyes 'Golden Year of Friendship' with China
properties.description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra met with Chinese Ambassador to Thailand, Han Zhiqiang, at the Ivory Room in the Government House in Bangkok on Wednesday.

properties.name: Changsha, China
properties.title: Many sentenced over 2022 building collapse in Changsha
properties.description: The owner of a collapsed building that killed dozens of people in 2022 was sentenced to 11 years in prison on Thursday.Four other former officials of Wangcheng district and Hunan province who neglected their duty were sentenced to three years and nine months to five years and six months in prison.

properties.name: Berlin, Germany
properties.title: 15th Media Forum China-Germany held in Berlin
properties.description: The 15th Media Forum China-Germany hosted by the Global Times was held in Berlin, Germany, from Monday to Wednesday.

properties.name: Changji, China
properties.title: Mute swans grace Beilong Lake, enchanting visitors
properties.description: Groups of mute swans played in the water, creating a picturesque harmony between humanity and nature in Zhengzhou Beilong Lake Wetland Park, Central China's Henan province.

properties.name: Wuxi, China
properties.title: Sixth World Buddhist Forum unveils Buddhism's artistic evolution
properties.description: Three themed exhibitions opened on Tuesday at Mount Xuedou in Ningbo, East China's Zhejiang province, to trace the spread of Buddhism in the country and the manifestation of its ideas and values in various kinds of art and crafts throughout history.

properties.name: Shenzhen, China
properties.title: China's Ding Wenyi earns DP World Tour exemption for 2025 season
properties.description: Ding Wenyi of China has topped the inaugural Global Amateur Pathway Ranking, earning a DP World Tour exemption for the 2025 season.

properties.name: Hangzhou, China
properties.title: Man arrested after year-long plot to steal safe, escape by boat in Hangzhou
properties.description: A man in eastern China's Zhejiang province has been placed under criminal detention after allegedly stealing a 50-kilogram safe from his former employer and making his getaway by boat, local police said Tuesday.

properties.name: Luang Prabang, Laos
properties.title: China, Laos release 770,000 fish fry into Mekong River
properties.description: China and Laos have jointly released 770,000 fish fry into the Mekong River, known as the Lancang River in China, in a stock enhancement activity as part of an effort to bolster aquatic biodiversity.

properties.name: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
properties.title: Forum focuses on the art of Buddhism
properties.description: Among these who made a name for themselves in Chinese art history were monks celebrated for combining art with Buddhism. These include the Four Monks of the early Qing Dynasty (1644-1911) — Zhu Da, Shitao, Hongren, and Kuncan — whose work can be found in the collections of museums, and which enjoy public popularity.

properties.name: Jiuquan, China
properties.title: Ancient village complex well preserved in NW China's Gansu::China launches new Earth observation satellite
properties.description: Aerial photo taken on Oct. 16, 2024, shows the Zhangba ancient village in northwest China’s Gansu Province.::China on Wednesday sent a new Earth observation satellite into space from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center in northwest China.

properties.name: Nanjing, China
properties.title: 21 Tibetan children with congenital heart disease receive free treatment in Nanjing
properties.description: Twenty-one Tibetan children with congenital heart disease have received free medical treatment at the Second Affiliated Hospital of Nanjing Medical University in Jiangsu Province this year thanks to a joint medical aid operation.

properties.name: Xining, China
properties.title: Delicate thangka paintings in NW China's Qinghai::Thousands of migratory birds rest in wetlands of Lake Gascule in NW China’s Qinghai
properties.description: A visitor takes photos of a thangka painting at the Renjun Painting Academy in Tongren, Huangnan Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture, Oct. 16, 2024.::Photo shows the autumn scenery of the Lake Gascule in Mangya city, northwest China's Qinghai Province.

properties.name: Brussels, Belgium
properties.title: Green transition key for agri-food sector
properties.description: Elouafi noted that China's adoption of technologies and innovations in the agri-food sector, along with its initiatives to enhance rural incomes, played a pivotal role in the success.

properties.name: Moscow, Russia
properties.title: Scientists mark 60th anniversary of nuclear program
properties.description: Scientists and their families gathered Wednesday at an old rocket research site in Beijing's Huairou district to commemorate the 60th anniversary of China's first atomic bomb test and reflect on the historic "Two Bombs and One Satellite" program.

properties.name: Dubai, United Arab Emirates
properties.title: HKPC's future manufacturing solutions shine at GITEX Global 2024::Multiple entry visa allowed for expats from two SARs
properties.description: On Monday, GITEX Global 2024, the world's most iconic technology exhibition opened in Dubai, the United Arab Emirates.::Starting Wednesday, foreign residents living in Hong Kong and Macao can apply for multiple-entry visas to the Chinese mainland with a validity period of up to five years by following a simplified procedure, according to the central government.

properties.name: Haikou, China
properties.title: Hainan to issue dim sum bonds in HK
properties.description: The country's southernmost province of Hainan plans to issue up to 3 billion yuan ($421.8 million) in offshore renminbi bonds in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, marking its third consecutive year of tapping the dim sum bond market.

properties.name: Naha, Japan
properties.title: China expels Japanese fishing boat from waters around Diaoyu Islands
properties.description: China expelled a Japanese fishing boat that illegally entered the territorial waters of the Diaoyu Islands, China Coast Guard (CCG) spokesman Liu Dejun said on Thursday.

properties.name: Fuzhou, China
properties.title: Fujian urged to lead modernization
properties.description: President Xi Jinping learns about dried seafood and the fishing harvest at a village in Dongshan county during an inspection tour in Zhangzhou, Fujian province, on Tuesday.

properties.name: Tashkent, Uzbekistan
properties.title: Li unveils proposal on deepening SCO cooperation
properties.description: On behalf of China, Premier Li Qiang has put forward a four-point proposal on deepening cooperation within the Shanghai Cooperation Organization.

properties.name: Washington, United States
properties.title: From Ping-Pong Diplomacy to educational exchanges: China and U.S. scholars urge greater cooperation
properties.description: “Educational and cultural exchanges contribute to mutual understanding of cultural differences and common humanity between the United States and China, which are vital ingredients for returning to better, more constructive relations ahead,” said Chief Representative of the University of Virginia (UVA) China Office Justin O’Jack at China-US Higher Education Dialogue on Saturday in Beijing.

properties.name: Taipei, Taiwan
properties.title: Former KMT chairperson expects more communication between Taiwan youths, Chinese mainland
properties.description: Hung Hsiu-chu, former chairperson of the Chinese Kuomintang (KMT) party, expressed her hope for greater communication between Taiwan's younger generation and the Chinese mainland during an interview with China News Service in Xi’an, Shaanxi Province, on Tuesday.

properties.name: Nanchang, China
properties.title: Xi visits Gu Wenchang memorial hall
properties.description: Xi Jinping, general secretary of the Communist Party of China (CPC) Central Committee, on Tuesday afternoon visited the Gu Wenchang memorial hall in Dongshan County during an inspection tour to Zhangzhou City, east China's Fujian Province.
